statement.title: Content
statement.content:
A triangular number is the number of dots in an equilateral triangle uniformly filled with dots. For example, three dots can be arranged in a triangle; thus three is a triangular number. The $n\_{th}$ triangular number is the number of dots in a triangle with n dots on a side. 

Your task is to find out if a given integer is a triangular number.

statement.title: Standard Input
statement.content: There are multi-cases, for each case there is only a single number $n$ ($1\leq  n\leq  500$) — the given integer.

statement.title: Standard Output
statement.content: For each case, if the given integer is a triangular number output `YES`, otherwise output `NO`.
